title: Riot can you help plox?

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
Riot can you please investigate this match.
The Varus in it got really toxic. 
He said he fucked my dad. I told him my dad was dead. 
His response was that he killed himself for being disappointed in me and that I should do the same.
IRL This weekend is the anniversary of the day my father killed himself.
I told varus (suicidalteenager) in the hopes he'd stop but he only got worse.
And I ended up in tears

I tried reporting him but that hasn't done anything.
I'm not really sure what else I can do about it so I'm posting here.

replies.body:
As Coolbluey said, the best course of action is to simply mute and report them. This type of behavior is not tolerated, but you won't always be notified when a player you report is punished; you only get a notification when your report triggered the punishment, but you still won't be told who or how.

Try to refrain from posting their names on the boards, though. It is considered "Name & Shame" and is against forum policy. If you feel the need to report a player outside the post-game reporting feature, submit it in a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and a Player Behavior Specialist will look into it.

I'm sorry to hear what happened Zarkd, people can be so mean sometimes. But the best thing to do is to mute them if they are really hurting you. Don't tell them if you do, just do it. If they continually ping you if you don't respond, remember that you can mute pings as well. Once again, very sorry to hear what happened, I don't know what riot will do about it but you can always do something.
People on the net can be dicks.
